author: .vbuterin
content: Has EVM384 stuff been going anywhere lately?

author: axic3354
content: We are in the process of reviving it. Have a summary document to share soon, plus a new experiment planned with a zk project.

author: axic3354
content: Combined with EOF we can make some nicer decisions.

author: .vbuterin
content: hmm, what is the connection to EOF? I thought EVM384 is just a set of opcodes or precompiles?

author: axic3354
content:
With EOF we can easily make it use immediates, or even consider putting the setup data (settings, modulus, inverse, etc.) into a specific section. In that case a contract is locked to a single modulus, but if we envision them to function as libraries/"precompiles" this is not a problem.

The benefit it has that we could potentially have consensus agreed optimised algorithms for various moduli if needed, but at least could clients could consider precalculating things on deploy time / before execution.

author: axic3354
content: This "setup section" is not a fully thought out idea yet, but something we want to prototype and see.

author: axic3354
content: Using immediates and a simplified addressing model to minimize the memory expansion check overhead is a more important one.

author: zemse
content: Is there a evm bytecode to assembly (mnemonics) converter? (edit: found feature called "disease" in etk)
